events.title: Central U.S. Floods
events.description: In late February 2018, heavy rains gave rise to damaging floods along the Ohio and Mississippi rivers.

events.title: Central Asia Heatwave
events.description: During the middle of February, temperatures averaged above normal over a wide area of Central Asia, including eastern Kazakhstan, northern Kyrgyzstan, Turkmenistan, and much of Afghanistan.

events.title: Connecticut River Ice Jams
events.description: Heavy rains and temperature swings triggered a long ice jam in Connecticut.

events.title: Southeast Asia Agricultural Burning
events.description: Every January through March, vast numbers of small fires spring up across the countryside in Southeast Asia. Those months usually bring cool, dry weather—perfect conditions for burning.

events.title: Cold Snap in the Northeast U.S.
events.description: As 2017 drew toward a close, Arctic air spilled into the eastern United States and Canada for several days.

events.title: Flash Floods, Greece
events.description: A slow-moving weather system in the Mediterranean brought torrential rain and flash floods to Greece.

events.title: Northern India Air Quality
events.description: A combination of fires, urban pollution, and bad weather caused a remarkable build-up of haze over northern India and Pakistan.

events.title: Agricultural Burning, India
events.description: Many farmers in India set fire to their fields to clear them before planting, a practice known as stubble burning.

events.title: Iceberg B44
events.description: The floating part of Antarctica’s Pine Island Glacier released a new, 185-square-kilometer iceberg. By late October 2017, the berg had fractured into pieces that are no longer large enough to be named and tracked.

events.title: Hurricane Franklin
events.description: The storm became the Atlantic Ocean basin’s first hurricane of 2017.

events.title: Greenland Wildfire
events.description: Fire is uncommon in Greenland, yet smoke plumes rose south of Disko Bay in August 2017.

events.title: Algae Bloom, Lake Erie
events.description: Since July 2017,  a large bloom of phytoplankton has been coloring western Lake Erie.

events.title: Montenegro Fires
events.description: Wildfires spread across the Adriatic coast of Montenegro after weeks of high temperatures in July. The Lustica peninsula has been the worst affected, where tourists and residents were forced to evacuate.

events.title: Norwegian Sea Bloom
events.description: Warming summer waters and ample sunlight make conditions right for phytoplankton to reproduce in abundance.

events.title: Southwest U.S. Heat Wave
events.description: Extreme heat in the U.S. Southwest is breaking meteorological records, canceling flights, and making life miserable for millions of people.

events.title: Flooding in U.S. Midwest
events.description: Several tributaries of the Mississippi River face record or near-record water levels.

events.title: Tropical Storm Arlene
events.description: The cyclone was one of the earliest Atlantic cyclones observed in the satellite record.

events.title: Tropical Storm Maarutha
events.description: It is the first named cyclone of 2017 in the northern hemisphere.

events.title: Peru, Colombia and Ecuador Flooding
events.description: Several weeks of intense rain have triggered severe floods and mudslides in Peru, Colombia and Ecuador.

events.title: Central Chile Fires
events.description: A heat wave coupled with strong winds has fueled forest fires in central Chile in January 2017.

events.title: Mount Frankland National Park Fire, Western Australia
Cocklebiddy, Dundas, Western Australia Fire
events.description: A bushfire in the Nuytsland Nature Reserve.

events.title: India Floods, August 2016
events.description: In August 2016, heavy monsoon rains pushed the Ganges and other rivers in eastern and central India above their banks.

events.title: Louisiana Floods, August 2016
events.description: On August 12, 2016, heavy rainfall started in Louisiana, sending area rivers toward historic crests and causing at least three fatalities and thousands of evacuated people.

events.title: Northern Portugal Fires
events.description: High temperatures combined with drought have provided the perfect conditions for the outbreak of fires in northern Portugal.

events.title: Lesotho Extreme Snowfall, July 2016
events.description: The heaviest snow in two decades blanketed Lesotho in late July 2016. The storm prompted the airlifts of at least eight tourists, and caused the deaths of several shepherds in the Joe Gqabi District Municipality, according to news reports.

events.title: Siberia Forest Fires, Russia, July 2016
events.description: Lightning triggered dozens of forest fires in Siberia in late June, and may have burned 3000 hectares. The fires are located in remote areas, and reportedly do not pose a threat to inhabited areas at this time, but a state of emergency has been declared in Kezhemskogo, Boguchansky, Evenki and Motyginsky districts.

events.title: Flooding in Southern China, June-July 2016
events.description: Storms in eight provinces in southern China - among them Hubei, Sichuan, Guizhou, Jiangxi, Yunnan, Zhejiang and Anhui - have caused severe floods and displaced over 200,000 people after days of heavy rain.

events.title: North Sea Phytoplankton Bloom
events.description: In May-June 2016, satellites captured images of a bloom in the North Sea.

events.title: East Texas Flooding, May-June 2016
events.description: Intense rainfall capped off the wettest month in Texas history, with a state average of 7.54 inches. The previous record was 6.66 inches in 2004. According to news sources, Texas was doused with more than 35 trillion gallons of rain in the month of May.

events.title: Sinabung Volcano, Indonesia
events.description: Mount Sinabung in Indonesia erupted on 21 May at 09:48 UTC (04:48 local time) and killed seven people in the nearby village of Gembar. The volcano is still erupting, pouring ash 3 km into the sky.

events.title: Fort McMurray Fire, Alberta, Canada
events.description: A destructive wildfire burned through Canada’s Northern Alberta region, razing neighborhoods in Fort McMurray and displacing tens of thousands of residents.

events.title: Mt. Sourabaya Volcano, Bristol Island, South Sandwich Islands
events.description: A volcano in the far South Atlantic appears to be erupting for the first time in 60 years.

events.title: Flooding in Houston, Texas
events.description: Nearly two feet of rain has resulted in extensive flooding in Houston, Texas.

events.title: Lake Kivu Whiting Event, Rwanda/DR Congo
events.description: The lake in central Africa is in the middle of a whiting event caused by calcium carbonate precipitation.

events.title: Antarctic Iceberg C33
events.description: A crack across the Nansen Ice Shelf in Antarctica has broken, shedding two icebergs—one large enough to earn the name C33.

events.title: Nepal WIldfires, April 2016
events.description: In Nepal, the dry month of April always brings an increase in fire activity.

events.title: Thailand Fires, March 2016
events.description: Smoke and charred forests are the result of fires burning in Thailand’s Huai Kha Khaeng Wildlife Sanctuary.

events.title: Landfill Fire, Mumbai, India
events.description: Smoke from the blaze streamed into neighborhoods in India’s most populous city.

events.title: South Korea Snowfall, January 2016
events.description: Jeju Island and other areas of the southwest mainland received extensive snowfall in January.

events.title: Bushfires, NW Tasmania
events.description: Fires have damaged prized forests in northwestern Tasmania.

events.title: San Miguel Volcano, El Salvador
events.description: San Miguel (also known as Chaparrastique) is one of the most active volcanoes in El Salvador.

events.title: Tropical Storm Pali
events.description: Hurricane Pali became the earliest hurricane on record in the Central Pacific when it achieved hurricane status 19 days earlier than the previous record holder, Hurricane Ekeka of 1992.

events.title: Oil Tank Fires, Libya
events.description: After battles in Libya on January 4–6, 2016, several fires were observed at oil production and storage facilities near Sidra, on the coast between Sirte and Benghazi. Smoke plumes from several oil tanks and facilities spread a pall of black smoke across the nation’s Mediterranean coast.

events.title: South America Floods, December 2015-January 2016
events.description: In December and January, heavy summer rains swamped this part of South America causing the Uruguay, Paraguay and Parana rivers to swell beyond flood stage.

events.title: Midwest U.S. Floods, January 2016
events.description: Three days of heavy rain have caused widespread flooding in the United States, stretching from Illinois down to Mississippi.

events.title: Eastern China Air Pollution, December 2015
events.description: Authorities in Beijing have issued a first-ever “red” air pollution alert.

events.title: Mount Etna Volcano, Italy
events.description: After a two-year respite, Sicily’s massive Etna volcano is showing signs of life.

events.title: Momotombo Volcano, Nicaragua
events.description: For the first time in more than a century, Nicaragua’s Momotombo Volcano awoke with an explosive eruption.

events.title: Extreme Cold and Snow (Dzud), Mongolia
events.description: Mongolia is experiencing very low temperatures and heavy snowfall since early November 2015, locally named Dzud.

events.title: Esperance Fires, Australia
events.description: Bush fires have damaged power lines, burned 133,000 hectares, and destroyed two homes.

events.title: Cyclone Chapala
events.description: After forming in the Arabian Sea, Cyclone Chapala headed for the Arabian Peninsula.

events.title: Iraq Flooding, October-November 2015
events.description: Heavy rains in late October caused flooding in and around Baghdad, as surface drainage is minimal.

events.title: Rinjani Volcano, Indonesia
events.description: In late October 2015, Mount Rinjani (3,726m) on the Indonesian island of Lombok began erupting. In the days that followed, ash from Rinjani blanketed towns and farmland across three Indonesian islands and shut down air traffic to a number of airports. Rinjani last erupted in 2009–2010.

events.title: South Carolina Floods
events.description: Heavy rainfall from a combination of tropical moisture and a non-tropical system resulted in heavy flooding in South Carolina.

events.title: Dust storms in Middle East
events.description: During early September 2015, a cyclone-shaped wall of dust and a series of dust storms swept across the Middle East and Persian Gulf.

events.title: Indonesia Fires, Fall 2015
events.description: Smoke poured from seasonal fires in Indonesia in the fall of 2015.

events.title: Explosion at Tianjin, China
events.description: Fires associated with a massive explosion in Tianjin, China, sent dark smoke drifting east and southeast.

events.title: Dust Storm over Southern Egypt
events.description: A wall of dust rolled north from Sudan into southern Egypt.

events.title: Reynolds Creek Fire, Montana
events.description: The Reynolds Creek fire was reported in the afternoon of July 21 and has prompted evacuations within Glacier National Park.

events.title: Lake Erie Algal Bloom
events.description: A bloom of algae continues to grow in Lake Erie and surrounding waters.

events.title: Dust storm over Libya and Egypt
Wildfires in Alberta and Saskatchewan
events.description: Dozens of uncontrolled fires are burning in northern Alberta and Saskatchewan.

events.title: Tanana Area Fires, Alaska
events.description: The Tanana Area Fires include Spicer Creek, Bering Creek, Harper Bend, Moose Point, and Kokrine fires, all of natural causes.

events.title: Lake Fire, California
events.description: The Lake Fire was reported just before 4:00 pm on June 17, 2015.

events.title: Tropical Storm Bill
events.description: Tropical Storm Bill, the second named storm of the 2015 hurricane season, pushed ashore near Matagorda Island, Texas, on June 16, 2015.

events.title: Sockeye Fire, Alaska
events.description: The fast-moving Sockeye Fire has grown very quickly and is expected to continue to grow due to hot, dry weather.

events.title: Democratic Republic of the Congo Fires, June 2015
events.description: In June 2015, seasonal fires dotted central Africa.

events.title: Fires in Northern Canada
events.description: Fires burned in the Northwest Territories, spreading smoke across the region.

events.title: Wolf Volcano
events.description: After 33 years of inactivity, Wolf volcano in the Galapagos has reawakened.

events.title: Sea of Marmara Phytoplankton Bloom
events.description: Freshened surface water and abundant nutrients lead to an explosion of algae in the inland sea.

events.title: Alaska Heat Wave, May 2015
events.description: In the third week of May, it was warmer in Fairbanks, Alaska, than in Washington, D.C. The small town of Eagle, Alaska, was hotter on May 23 than it has been on any day in Houston or Dallas this year. In what has become a frequent occurrence in the past few years, temperature profiles in North America appeared to be upside down.

events.title: Calbuco Volcano, Chile
events.description: Calbuco volcano, located in the province of Llanquihue, state of Los Lagos, southern Chile, erupted on 22 Apr 2015.

events.title: Raung Volcano, Indonesia
events.description: One of the most active volcanoes on the Indonesian island of Java spewed fresh ash and gases in early July 2015.
